legalese.contactNote: Comments or questions about this document may be may be addressed to:

div1.head: Notes to Readers
div1.p: This content represents an addendum to Immunization Administration Release 1. New artifacts added as part of this release:

list.item: Storyboard DOIZ_ST000004UV (Getting a patient-specific immunization recommendation and status
Trigger Events POIZ_TE070010UV (Patient Immunization Status Requested) and POIZ_TE070020UV (Request for Patient Immunization Statis Received)
RMIM/HMD/MT POIZ_XX070010UV (Patient Immunization Status Query) and POIZ_XX070020UV (Patient Immunization Status Query Response)
Interactions POIZ_IN070010UV (Patient Immunization Status Query Request) and POIZ_IN070020UV (Patient Immunization Status Query Response)

div2.head: Introduction & Scope
div2.p: This domain describes communication of information about immunization: the administration of vaccines (and/or antisera) to individuals to prevent infectious disease.

The messages used to communicate information about immunization are a restricted set of specializations of the basic Pharmacy domain messages. They use the messages to support the Prescribe, Dispense and Administration processes, and statements and queries that support these. This is appropriate, since immunization is a "specialization" or a "specialist implementation" of a substance administration and the vaccine is a "specialization" of a medication.

All the general information about architectures, application descriptions, timing specification and object identification from the Pharmacy Domain is relevant to the Immunization Domain. However, it is not repeated here for brevity. Readers should reference the Pharmacy Domain introduction for this information.

descriptive.name: Reference
descriptive.p: For details on the interpretation of this section, see in the Version 3 Guide.

story.name: Immunization Administration
story.familiarName: Utilizing and Accessing an Immunization Registry

descriptive.name: Purpose
descriptive.p: The Immunization Registry is a data store that indicates the immunization status of individual clients. It includes information regarding: client identification, immunizing agent(s), immunization date(s), vaccine identification, immunization provision information, contraindications, exemptions, precautions and previous vaccine associated adverse events (VAAE).

Special considerations in immunization include: obtaining consent, assessing and recording VAAE, documenting medical, religious and/or conscientious exemptions, listing contraindications and precautions and recording notifications.
Nurse Nightingale works at an immunization clinic. The following activities occur during the course of a typical day.

list.item:
Nurse Nightingale receives an alert of a hepatitis B outbreak within her jurisdiction. She runs queries against the jurisdictional Client and Immunization Registries to identify individuals who are not fully immunized against hepatitis B. She begins by getting a list of eligible candidates from the Client Registry. The registry responds with a list of all eligible immunization candidates, who live within her jurisdiction. Next she gets a list of all of their immunization events from the Immunization Registry. By comparing the results, she is able to determine who has not yet received their hepatitis B vaccination.
Interactions: Patient Registry Get Demographics Query () and Patient Registry Get Demographics Query Response() Immunization Candidate Query () and Immunization Candidate Query Response ()

Nightingale administers an MMR vaccine to Kari Kidd and records the event on the jurisdiction's immunization registry.
Interactions: Record Immunization Request () and Record Immunization Request Accepted ()

Neville Nuclear has accepted a new job as a healthcare worker. His employer has asked for a copy of his hepatitis B vaccinations. Neville completed the entire 3 dose series six months ago at the public health travel clinic. Nightingale queries the Immunization Registry and is presented with the dates and details for each of the three hepatitis B doses.
Interactions: Immunization Candidate Query () and Immunization Candidate Query Response ()She then queries for greater detail against each of the listed immunization records.
Interactions: Immunization Query () and Immunization Query Response ().Nurse Nightingale prints an official vaccination report for Mr. Nuclear.

story.name: Immunization Candidate Query
story.familiarName: Retrieving a list of immunization records

descriptive.name: Purpose
descriptive.p: The Immunization Registry is a data store that indicates the immunization status of individual clients. It includes information regarding: client identification, immunizing agent(s), immunization date(s), vaccine identification, immunization provision information, contraindications, exemptions, precautions and previous vaccine associated adverse events (VAAE).

In some circumstances, it is necessary to confirm a patient's identity prior to retrieving a list of immunization events associated with a particular patient. In these situations, identity confirmation is facilitated by the use of a patient demographic query and a list of immunization events is requested using the immunization candidate query.

Neville Nuclear is traveling overseas and has an appointment with his public health nurse to determine what vaccinations he requires. Nurse Nightingale confirms Neville's identity by querying the jurisdictional client registry.
Interactions: Patient Registry Get Demographics Query () and Patient Registry Get Demographics Query Response()
She then queries the jurisdictional immunization registry for a list of all the vaccine administrations that Neville has received.
Interactions: Immunization Candidate Query () and Immunization Candidate Query Response ()

descriptive.name: Purpose
descriptive.p: The Immunization Registry is a data store that indicates the immunization status of individual clients. It includes information regarding: client identification, immunizing agent(s), immunization date(s), vaccine identification, immunization provision information, contraindications, exemptions, precautions and previous vaccine associated adverse events (VAAE).
Nurse Nightingale administers an MMR vaccine to Kari Kidd and notifies the jurisdiction's immunization registry about the vaccine administration.
Interaction: Record Immunization Notification()

After a few minutes, Kari develops some swelling around the injection site. Nurse Nightingale updates Kari's immunization record to note this reaction and notifies the jurisdictional immunization registry about the change.
Interaction: Update Immunization Notification()

descriptive.name: Purpose
descriptive.p: The purpose of this storyboard is to describe the activities involved in retrieving the immunization recommendation and current immunization status from an immunization registry for an identified client.

The Immunization Registry is a data store and application that indicates the immunization status of individual clients. It includes information regarding: client identification, immunization date(s), vaccine/antigen identification, immunization provision administration information, contraindications, exemptions, precautions, previous vaccine associated adverse events (VAAE) and the immunization profile.
Patient-specific immunization recommendation and current immunization status information needs to be retrieved from an immunization registry

list.item: There are likely to be intermediary processes or service calls made by the immunization registry that are performed prior to sending the query response. Such processes may likely include the retrieval of immunization or other patient medical history, evaluation of the patient's immunization history according to a set of clinical guidelines, and execution of immunization decision support software components. The receiver may retrieve data from the local immunization registry data store or from a remote data store; processes may be invoked locally by the immunization registry application, remotely as web service calls, or by other methods. These processes may be invoked by the receiver in direct response to the query, and executed prior to returning a response.

Patient identity has been resolved prior to submitting this query. The patient related non-identifer parameters are not intended to be used in a demographics search, but for the receiving system to use to confirm the submitted identifier). The patient-related parameters are also not intended to be used as parameters to the intermediate processes described above; for example, Date of Birth and Gender parameters are not intended to replace stored patient demographics that may be retrieved by the receiver in response to this query for use in a decision support intermediate step.

descriptive.p: Neville Nuclear has an appointment with his family doctor to receive his second hepatitis A vaccination prior to travelling overseas. His doctor, Family Fay, queries the Immunization Registry is presented with Neville's profile along with his immunization recommendations, status and information to support the recommendations and declarations of status.
Interactions: Patient Immunzation Status Query Request () and Patient Immunzation Status Query Response()

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: The Immunization DMIM contains the following key concepts:

list.item: Immunization - information about the immunization substance administration. If an immunization event did not occur, the negation indicator should be set to True.
Informant - information about the source of the information regarding the substance administration. Examples include: patient, patient's agent, and provider.
Health Document - indicates that the immunization event is noted on a health document such as an immunization card.
Subject - the patient who received the immunization.
Responsible Party - the provider who has overall responsibility for the immunization event.
Performer - the provider who administered the vaccine to the patient.
Author - the provider who created the immunization record.
Consumable - the vaccine administered to the patient in the immunization event.
Prescription - information relating to a prescription if one is applicable.
Protocol Definition - information relating to the immunization schedule which the immunization event fulfills.
Annotation Indicator - used in query responses to indicate that an annotation is associated with the immunization event in question.
Annotation - Annotations or notes that are recorded along with an immunization event.
Detected Issue Indicator - used in query responses to indicate that a detected issue is associated with the immunization event in question.
Issues - issues that are recorded along with an immunization event.
Investigation Event - used to reference an existing adverse event report if one is associated with the immunization event.
Intolerance Condition - used to reference existing intolerances if they are recorded along with the immunization event.
Consent - used to indicate that consent was or was not given.
Location - information about the facility in which the immunization was given to the patient.
Reason - used to register reasons for the immunization event, or reasons that the vaccine was not administered to the patient. If an immunization event did not occur.

descriptive.name: Introduction
descriptive.p: This topic covers the recording and querying of immunization records.

descriptive.name: Reference
descriptive.p: For details on the interpretation of this section, see and their relationships in the Version 3 Guide.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This is a system which supports a clinician in recording or updating of immunizations on the immunization portion of an EHR.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This is a repository that is capable of receiving and responding to requests for recording and revising immunization events.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This is a system which supports a clinician in recording or updating of immunizations on the immunization portion of an EHR. The differentiation between this application role and the Immunization Recorder is that systems playing this role are not expected to process responses from the EHR System or Immunization Registry.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This is a repository of immunization events. The differentiation between this application role and the EHR System (Immunization) is that systems playing this role are not expected to return responses to the originating system.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This is a system which supports a clinician in querying of the immunization portion of an EHR.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: User attempts to update a previously entered immunization record.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: The request to update an existing immunization record has been refused. e.g. No permission, record not found, etc.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: An existing immunization record has been updated.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: User attempts to record an immunization for a patient.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: A request to record an immunization has been refused (e.g. The user has no permission,patient not recognized, etc.)

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: An immunization has been recorded against a patient.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: A user or system requires a list of immunizations for a patient or population.

descriptive.name: Description

descriptive.name: Description

intref.refName: Immunization Event Recommendation and Status Query Response

descriptive.name: Reference
descriptive.p: For details on the interpretation of this section, see in the Version 3 Guide.

rmim.name: Immunization Event Complete Recommendation and Status Query Response

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: A query response that returns a patient's immunization status and recommendation. This message payload is determined after the immunization registry performs steps such as: evaluating the patient's immunization history, comparing immunization history to the recommended immunization schedule, evaluate patient precautions, etc.
Contained within the payload is the patient's immunization profile which includes the patient's vaccine status as well as information to support the vaccine status declaration.

hmdref.refName: Immunization Event Complete Recommendation and Status Query Response

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This RMIM is used to record an immunization event for a specific patient.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This query is used to return a list of immunization events that have been filtered by the specified query criteria. The intent of this query is to find candidate immunization events that may or may not be associated with a specific patient. As unique patient identifiers are not always available, a number of other parameters are included to identify a patient.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This RMIM is used to return candidate query responses. The key differentiator between the Immunization Candidate Query reponse and the Immunization Query response is that the Immunization Query response contains more information about the immunization event(s) in question.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This query is used to request detailed information about a specific patient's immunization event(s). The intent of this query is to find immunization events associated with a specific patient. As unique patient identifiers are not always available, a number of other parameters are included to identify a patient.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This RMIM is used to return detailed information about specific immunization events. The key differentiator between the Immunization Candidate Query reponse and the Immunization Query response is that the Immunization Query response contains more information about the immunization event(s) in question.

rmim.name: Immunization Event Recommendation and Status Query

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: Requests information about a specified patient's immunization recommendation and current immunization status from an immunization repository.

hmdref.refName: Immunization Event Recommendation and Status Query

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This RMIM is used to update a previously recorded immunization event. Additions are permitted, but changing of information is not. Patient, medication and event author information is included for verification purposes only. The mechanism for revising information expressed as a CMET in the model should be to retract the record and then submit a new record with the revised information.

descriptive.name: Reference
descriptive.p: For details on the interpretation of this section, see in the Version 3 Guide.

hmd.name: Immunization Event Complete Recommendation and Status Query Response

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: A query response that returns a patient's immunization status and recommendation. This message payload is determined after the immunization registry performs steps such as: evaluating the patient's immunization history, comparing immunization history to the recommended immunization schedule, evaluate patient precautions, etc.
Contained within the payload is the patient's immunization profile which includes the patient's vaccine status as well as information to support the vaccine status declaration.

rmimref.refName: Immunization Event Complete Recommendation and Status Query Response

descriptive.name: Description

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This HMD is used to return detailed information about specific immunization events.

hmd.name: Immunization Event Recommendation and Status Query

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: Requests information about a specified patient's immunization recommendation and current immunization status from an immunization repository.

rmimref.refName: Immunization Event Recommendation and Status Query

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: This HMD is used to update a previously recorded immunization event. Additions are permitted, but changing of information is not. Patient, medication and event author information is included for verification purposes only. The mechanism for revising information expressed as a CMET in the model should be to retract the record and then submit a new record with the revised information.

descriptive.p: Indicates that the revision has been accepted.

descriptive.name: Reason
descriptive.p: Indicates that the revision has been rejected.

descriptive.name: Description

descriptive.name: Description

descriptive.name: Description

descriptive.name: Description

descriptive.name: Reason
descriptive.p: Indicates that the immunization event has been recorded.

descriptive.name: Reason
descriptive.p: Indicates that the receiver refused to record the immunization event.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: Indicates that the request to add an immunization to the patient record has been denied.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: Indicates that the request to add an immunization event to the patient record has been accepted.

descriptive.name: Description
descriptive.p: Requests retrieval of a list of candidate immunization events, potentially filtered by paramters such as: time-range of the immunization, service delivery location, subejct ID, subject name, date of birth etc.

div3.head: International Immunization Specifications
div3.p: This topic provides several examples of HL7 affiliate project immunization content including detailed specifications and/or Implementation Guides. This content is provided to illustrate how the HL7 immunization specification can be constrained to meet the distinct business requirements and architectural designs adopted by different international affiliates and/or implementations.

Because the content developed by these projects and/or implementations has been developed as "early adoption" of the immunuzation specifications, there may be discrepancies between the content published in the HL7 balloted standard and the affiliate specifications. These differences arise for the following reasons:

list.item: Realm artifacts may be based on an earlier version of the HL7 pharmacy standard. As the standard proceeds through the ballot process it has continued to evolve.
In some cases, realm projects have been driven by near-term requirements for messages, interactions and data-elements which had not yet been addressed by the international standard.
Artifact identifiers have been kept separate for both the above reasons, as well as to avoid confusion and collision with the official HL7 specification.

p.emph: Obligation of the Public Health and Emergency Response SIG

div3.p: The affiliate content provide here is NOT being published as subject to ballot. Comments submitted will not be subject to normal ballot resolution and the PHER SIG does not commit to respond to individual ballot comments. This content will be subject to ballot approval at the affiliate level using whatever approval mechanism is in place for that HL7 affiliate, and based on the timelines associated with each project. Comments are, however, more than welcome and all comments submitted will be reviewed by the committee to aid in deciding how to internationalize affiliate content. All feedback provided will also be forwarded to the respective international projects for their own local consideration.

It is the intention of both the affiliates and the HL7 PHER SIG to continue evolving their respective specifications such that all affiliate specifications will be proper subsets of the HL7 international specifications. International specification information is included in the tables below.

tr.td: The CeRx project is sponsored by Canada Health Infoway (www.infoway.ca). Its objective is to develop HL7 v3 specifications for all areas which are pharmacy-related and are required for the implementation of a pan-Canadian EHR. It is running in parallel with other projects developing provider and client registry specifications, and will be supplemented by other projects in such areas as Lab and Public Health Surveillance.
